intro: Psychotria gigantifolia, commonly known as the giant leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, clustered white flowers that are often accompanied by a strong, unpleasant odor. Psychotria gigantifolia is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecosystem as a food source for certain insects and animals.
